author: jwoolley
msg: The extern "C" {} should not encompass any #include's.

author: wrowe
msg: We appear to never have had any complaints about copy srcname dstname
not overwriting dstname ... this flavor is certain not to emit a file
exists error [with the obvious caviat - if it's write protected, your
problem.]  Much simpler than /y, <.y or set copycmd fooness.

author: brianp
msg: Updated the unsigned character handling in apr_strmatch()

author: gstein
msg: Fix two nits that I saw while looking at this file:
* the C++ wrapper should not wrap any #include of other files. we
don't want to impose our namespace stuff on those files.
* add extra parens around the APR_DATE_BAD value to ensure that it
